text: today I'm super excited to share with
you the formula for a picture-perfect
pie like this one Thanksgiving it's all
about the turkey it's the centerpiece of
your table but pies are super important
too and I'm gonna go through just what
you need to know in terms of decorating
or embellishing the top crust of your
double crust pie now you can follow
whichever recipe is your family's
favorite so to create that
picture-perfect top what you need to do
is you need to go to the bottom of your
recipe and there's usually a step called
making a wash usually an egg wash
something that you're brushing over the
top crust of your pie now recipes have
different techniques and different
ingredients here in front of me I have
little circles of dough that have been
brushed with cream this is cream this is
egg yolk and this is egg white and you
can see the color and machine you'll get
with your pie crust so this first one I
have here this is if you brush the top
of your pie with just heavy cream now
heavy cream is high in fat and so what
that will do is it will give you a
beautiful golden brown color but it
usually has a matte finish it's not
shiny and my preference is I want that
golden brown color and also that
beautiful shine and that's really what
you achieve if you used egg yolk so egg
yolk is very very high in fat and it
gives you that wonderful golden brown
color that really impressive and lovely
shine and you can really see the
difference between this and the heavy
cream it doesn't get as crackle E as the
heavy cream does so my preferred method
I'll give you the hint it's right here
with egg yolk also some recipes call for
brushing with a little bit of egg white
not usually yields a very pale crust
because it doesn't have a fat that gives
that wonderful color so if you do have a
recipe that does say use egg white you
know generally you will get a good shine
to it but you won't get that golden
brown color so my preference and how I
would guide you is use the egg yolk now
you could simply do that as your wash
but I like to add a little bit of
sparkle and I also like
to add a little element or texture of
crunch so I really like to embellish the
tops of the pies with some type of sugar
now my preferred sugar would be sanding
sugar which is this crystal-clear sugar
it's really really sparkly and that
sparkle really holds up well in the
baking process so my perfect combination
would be egg yolk and fine sanding sugar
you could also use coarse landing sugar
and if you want a rustic pie you can use
this turbinado sugar which is a sugar in
the raw it has good color and good
crunch and then if you didn't have any
of these specialty sugars on hands you
could certainly use granulated sugar you
just won't get as much Sparkle so there
you have it guys a few little tricks and
tips for your favorite recipe you'll now
have a picture-perfect Thanksgiving pie
enjoy Happy Thanksgiving
